thread.title_full: Donald Tsang to serve jail term in same prison as his former chief secretary Rafael Hui

author: Chris Lau, Eddie Lee
title: Donald Tsang to serve jail term in same prison as his former chief secretary Rafael Hui
text:
Donald Tsang to serve jail term in same prison as his former chief secretary Rafael Hui 
Former Hong Kong chief executive will serve his 20-month term in the maximum-security Stanley Prison, source confirms  19pm  30pm Hong Kong’s crisis of confidence in rule of law and enforcement 23 Feb 2017 
Jailed former Hong Kong chief executive Donald Tsang Yam-kuen will be spending his 20 months’ incarceration in the maximum-security Stanley Prison, where his former right-hand man is also serving a jail term, the Post has learned. 
Tsang, who fell from grace last week after being found guilty of misconduct, is expected to be transferred to the prison from Lai Chi Kok Reception Centre as soon as Friday morning, a source familiar with the matter said. 
Stanley Prison, situated on the exclusive south corner of the Hong Kong Island, has also been home for Rafael Hui Si-yan, chief secretary under Tsang’s administration, since he was found guilty and sentenced to seven and a half years’ jail for a string of bribery and misconduct charges in 2014. 
It is understood that the decision to send Tsang to Stanley was reached in a meeting by the Correctional Service Department’s Classification and Category Board on Thursday. 
His wife of half a century, Selina Tsang Pou Siu-mei, paid Tsang a visit a day after Tsang spent his first night behind bars. 
Ex-civil servant challenges decision not to pursue two key figures in trial of former Hong Kong leader Donald Tsang 
Selina Tsang did not comment when she arrived at the Lai Chi Kok Reception Centre, accompanied by Tsang’s younger sister Katherine Tsang King-suen and brother Tsang Yam-huen. 
She earlier vowed to lodge an appeal for her husband, as the 72-year-old became the first chief executive in the city’s history ever to be jailed. 
High Court judge Mr Justice Andrew Chan Hing-wai sentenced Tsang to 20 months in prison on Wednesday for one count of misconduct in public office. 
Although Tsang had been remanded in custody since Monday, he had not been serving his time in a jail. Rather he spent two nights in hospital following complaints of a severe cough, until he was brought to court for the sentencing on Wednesday. 
He was found guilty last week by the jury in a 8-1 majority verdict of deliberately concealing his negotiation over a Shenzhen penthouse linked to businessman Bill Wong Cho-bau, when Tsang granted various applications by radio station Wave Media, of which Wong was a shareholder, between 2010 and 2012. 
The judge said at the time:“ Never in my judicial career have I seen a man fallen from so high .” 
He said the former city leader had breached the trust placed upon him by the people of Hong Kong and the Beijing government. 
Tsang’s family members stepped out of a seven-seater van at the front gate of the Lai Chi Lok Reception Centre at about 2:30pm on Thursday. 
They proceeded to a registration building, where the sister, Katherine Tsang, carried out necessary paperwork, while Tsang’s wife Selina sat down waiting, switching her glance from time to time between a television playing a prisoner-based drama and the emptiness in the air. 
They were assisted by the prison guards, and eventually entered the reception centre surrounded by members of the press. 
They left shortly after 4:15pm with the help of Correctional Service Department officers to push their way through a media pack.
